entities.description: The time frame referenced in the survey, typically the past 12 months.
Use of hallucinogens by the respondent.
Use of inhalants by the respondent.
Problems at work, such as missing work, getting fired, or losing job opportunities.
Problems at school, such as missing school, getting suspended, or dropping out.
Issues in taking care of family responsibilities.
Problems related to mental health due to substance use.
Physical health problems associated with substance use.
Social issues, such as arguments or problems with family and friends.
Need to use more of a substance to achieve the same effect or experiencing less effect with the same amount.

relationships.description: Relates the survey to the time period referenced in the questions.
Indicates that the respondent has experienced problems at work due to substance use.
Indicates that the respondent has experienced problems at school due to substance use.
Indicates that the respondent has experienced problems with family responsibilities due to substance use.
Indicates that the respondent has mental health issues related to substance use.
Indicates that the respondent has physical health issues related to substance use.
Indicates that the respondent has social problems, such as arguments with family or friends, due to substance use.
Indicates that the respondent has developed a tolerance to the substance.
Indicates that the respondent uses hallucinogens.
Indicates that the respondent uses inhalants.
